Reviews.Title: “bedbugs...”
Reviews.Author: rnsrnsrns
Reviews.Content: I never write anything on Tripadvisor other than for this. Bedbugs. Beware. Location of the hotel is not even that convenient. and room was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Amiralij
Reviews.Content: I stayed at York hotel for 3 nights in March, The location is really good as it is a walking distance to Orchard road but everything else is average, though the service was fine I must say. The rooms are comfortable but seem old. the shower tab was old and loose. I think this hotel needs a total renovation.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: debbiefrances
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my 11 year old daughter and found it very comfortable and clean. Had a great night sleep as the bed was so comfortable. The room was cleaned and towels changed every day. There was complimentary water but items from mini bar were chargeable as in most hotels. The breakfast was buffet style and food was good, hot and plenty full,even my fussy daughter could always find something. The restaurant was always very busy and a queue for the fresh eggs was always long but apart from that the staff were helpful and I had no problems what so ever and had a very enjoyable stay. I did experience difficulty trying to make a local call from my room but went to reception and they telephoned on my behalf and I wasn't charged for the call. The hotel was located about 5 minuits walk from Orchard Road, by Pentagon which had lots of good but expensive shopping malls. Go to the Asian Food Hall and have a great meal for less than $5 and tasted delicious!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Lesley1962
Reviews.Content: upon arrival we were upgraded in a spacious room overlooking the pool, very spacious and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful, good selection of food at the breakfast buffet. Only a few minutes walk to Orchard Road

Reviews.Title: “York Hotel Singapore :)”
Reviews.Author: Angel K
Reviews.Content: We ahd a premier room was a great room we had 3 adults a teen ager and a child in the one room big beds very firm mattresses and pillows staff where fantastic and had great knowledge only down side was walking through the restraunt to get to the pool the kids had room service and enjoyed it internet was quite expencive and the strenth of the signal was random all in all 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs in a Singapore Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Msafir
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the York Hotel as a stopover holiday package via Singapore airline on the 1st week of April 2012. By the second night my two kinds developed a skin rush, we later discovered they were bed bugs under their skin. We did put in a verbal complaint to the hotel manager, about poor hygiene at the hotel or the hotel room we were given and he was very quick to deny any responsibility, he demanded to see proof which he did and still he was trying to make excuses. For the amount of money the hotel charges per room per night and the type of services offered it was very poor. On reflection we should have explored our options abit more before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: John_Brisvagas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7 nights December 2011, 2 adults and 2 teenage daughters. Stayed in a premier room which were huge and ample room for the 4 of us. The Hotel is located in a great location approx 5 minutes walk to Orchid Road. Breakfast was great and service couldn't be faulted. Hotel is very clean. We would highly recommend this hotel for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “rude rude rude”
Reviews.Author: bongkeh
Reviews.Content: Customer service skill needed for the housekeeping. the hotel is old, but not bad. I was asking for another extra towel, and they asked me in such a rude tone "are you staying 3 person in your room??" no, it was only me, but I need more towel at that day. do I need to elaborate more, I have a very thick long hair and I never mixed a hair towel with bath towel? I dont think so. a hotel service who cant speak nicely? I feel like im in the hawker food stall.

Reviews.Title: “great location and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Dale B
Reviews.Content: great location and very clean and tidy rooms. The service was excellent and the pool really good. we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttish_Wanderers
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good for Orchard road which is a short walk away. The hotel itself is nice enough, no major complaints. The room was clean and the staff were helpful. The breakfast was a buffet and was ok. The room was nothing special and a reasonable size for Singapore. Overall it was a pleasant stay but not overly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers rooms available”
Reviews.Author: woodenshoe_8
Reviews.Content: York Hotel is situated close to Orchard Road and Scott Road. However also Singapore does not promote smoking, York Hotel has 2 floors with rooms for smokers (second and third floor). Early booking for such a room is necessary: many visitors like those rooms (no smell of smoking). York has all facilities for a four stars hotel, however the restaurant/bar is not really inviting (open, not cosy). Internet access is not free (cards for 2 hours and more available at the reception desk). American Club in Scott Road is at walking distance via rear entrance of the hotel along Goodwood Park Hotel. Orchard Road is well known for all the big shopping centres but also Scott Road has a lot of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular but nothing wrong either.”
Reviews.Author: WanderingBear840
Reviews.Content: Decent, clean hotel at reasonable price (if booked through independent web sites) in the Orchard Road area. Nothing spectacular but nothing wrong either. One big drawback is the lack of free wifi and the high cost of the internet. Short, 8 – 10 minute walk down the hill to Orchard Road shopping malls (Paragon, Lucky Plaza, and Ngee Ann City including Takashimaya department store and the huge Kinokuniya bookstore). It is also very convenient to Mount Elizabeth Hospital but be forewarned that if you are in Singapore for health reasons, access to hotel from the Hospital side requires climbing 12 – 15 steep steps with no ramp. During peak periods of check-out, there is also insufficient staff to help with luggage. But if you are hale and hearty, decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: WJQuah
Reviews.Content: We booked a four persons room and the room was indeed spacious. The service was poor at the reception with unfriendly staff and room service was poor too as we requested for toothbrush and have to wait for several hours although they said only few minutes. The hotel is very near to Orchard Road but after a long day walk you will feel tired to climb up the road to hotel. The bell boy just stood there and we have to open the main door ourselve.

Reviews.Title: “Suites Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: garuy
Reviews.Content: This is a very different property, maybe 40 years old but refurbished. They have no bar really and you need to walk through the restaurant to get to some of the rooms. When I was there they had a Hawker Fair as part of the restaurant and the smell of the food was nauseating as you passed through the restaurant. The funny odors went up the elevator and even my room on the 9th floor had an unpleasant odor. The plus is that you can get a very good price on this and you are one minute from Orchard walking. There is also a great restaurant complex in the hotel just 30 meters away, they have a great steakhouse called the Gordon Grill, absolute world beater, best steak I have had in Asia, including Japan. The hotel is best described as a Chinese 4 Star, lots of marble, big spaces and absolutely no charm or service. The people recognise you need help but are in slow motion, perhaps because of hours worked. Not Singaporean at all and I felt I had made a quick trip to Inland China or some of the dubious 4 Stars of Kuala Lumpur. I had a suite which I would recommend with two families or family with older children. The pull out coach in a separate room and this is really hard to find in Singapore and at a price that was well below Singapore rates. They also have a great fitness club even though there were no towels until 30 minutes after they opened it and they saw I was there, too busy changing signs and trying to waste some time! Could be so much better but then they would have to charge for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Boswell4
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good location ... just a short walk to Orchard Road!

Reviews.Title: “very ordinary, 4 star hotel????????????”
Reviews.Author: rotelena
Reviews.Content: (+): 1.Room ist ok, clean and big 2.no problem with hot water 3.Room service and house keeping, they are ok 4.All the staff are nice (-): 1. the stairs on the front door, is little bit troublesome for elderly, No access for people with handicapped/wheelchaired from main lobby 2.location of the hotel is also not pretty close to the city/orchard road, it needed about 15 minutes walk by foot and the road is uphill 3.swimming pool is without lifeguard and avaluable only till 7 pm 4.we get mineralwater only on the weekend, during the week none 5.Internet access very expensive, 15minute cost 2 SGD 6.Not enough channels on the TV, boring ...

Reviews.Title: “York Hotel, great for families”
Reviews.Author: CatherineWatson70
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and stayed at York Hotel in December and January. We got a large room with two king beds, the kids slept in one bed, (ages 12,8 and 4) and it worked well. The rooms are a generous size and the bathrooms nice and big too. We enjoyed being able to stroll down to Orchard Road and taxis are fairly easy to get and cheap! Enjoyed the botanic gardens (go early before it gets too hot) and the hotel pool. Wasn't tempted to eat at the hotel as we love Chinatown for food. I also highly recommend Roxy Laksa (East Coast lagoon) a bit of a hike as near the airport but the laksa was great and so cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, clean and easy”
Reviews.Author: Thurbonator
Reviews.Content: Neat and spotless hotel. Our family room was HUGE and the beds were really comfy. Common areas of the hotel didnt have a huge amount going for them, but the pool was clean and met the approval of my four year old. Room service was fast and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “OK value for money”
Reviews.Author: Richo12
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I have stayed at the York Hotel in the past 2 years. The reason I stay there is because it is reasonable value close to Orchard Road. I don't have any meals there, because it is so close to the many restaurants and cafes on Orchard Road. The only real negative is that it is a slow climb up the hill from Orchard Road to the Hotel!!! Maybe I need to get a little fitter! It is value for money and position. Would recommend you upgrade to a bigger room - it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade to a Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: theprincessw
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I need to be close to the Mt. Elizabeth hospital, however I do have to warn that despite the short distance, the walk to (or from) the hospital is a bit rough for someone who is very sick. Aside from the accessibility from the hospital, I did had a really nice time in this hotel. The receptionist upgraded my Superior booking to "Premier" room. I was in shock to see how big and chic this room is. There are 2 king size beds in the room, so for a start, this room can sleep even 6-8 people (officially only allow 4). The bed is so cozy, that I slept like a baby. They have a walk in closet and 2 wash basins in the bathroom. And here's why I love the interior of the room: the panelling on the wall is quilted (fake) leather that looks really modern, the carpet is fluffy, polka dot lace curtain, modern looking lounge chairs, and to such small detail in the interior like sleek black lamp. I would advise to not go for the breakfast though, it's just terrible and not much choice either. So you'd rather order a room service, which is cheaper. As for service, well, there was no doormen most of the time, the receptionist and front desk are nowhere to be found at night (also lacking out of smiles at night), concierge not very helpful and seems to be unwilling to help. But, the morning receptionist was great when I checked out. Honestly, I wouldn't stay here any more if it weren't for the premier room.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Live_frm_AsiaPac
Reviews.Content: I stayed six nights at the York Hotel- 2 nights in a Superior and 4 nights in a Family Deluxe Suite. Check in went smoothly and the folks were friendly and efficient. Concierge was awesome, checking baggage, arranging taxis, etc. There was a fairly constant supply of taxis outside the hotel but not all the time. Sometimes I walked down to Mt Elizabeth Hospital to catch a taxi there. The Superior room was quite small but clean. The only thing lacking was the bath tub. It was very small, cracked and marked tile around it, and stained. Everything else was very good. We had a queen bed in the room and we had just enough room to walk around it; however there was a sitting couch that could have worked for a second bed (for a small person) so that took up some room. The Family suite was *huge*! Here the bathtub was much bigger, we had one king bed and two fulls that we pushed together. We had 3 children and 2 adults in the room and never felt like we were cramped. I would highly recommend the suite for a family. There was no room division so you have to go to the sleep the same time as the kids, or hang out in the bathroom. It did have a walk in closet, which was enough to stack our 5 suitcases in. Room service was good; food was hot and good (but not great). Skip breakfast! Very expensive, limited Western menu and the food was mediocre tending towards lacking. The staff was nice, but it was S$75 for 1 adult/1child. The walk up to the hotel from Orchard should be a consideration if you have *any* walking issues; limp, sprain, winded easily. The sidewalk is uneven in a few spots, it is a 30% grade -going up hill after a few hours of shopping/walking is notable. You can take a taxi from Paragon (mall at Mt Elizabeth and Orchard) up to the hotel but because of one way streets, it isn't a direct drive. Maybe S$4 - 5 because of the pick up charge (S$3.50). There is a Pizza Hut in Lucky Plaza that is awesome (but doesn't deliver to York) and a McDonalds a little further down; for those of us who's children eat at those places. Overall a nice place and we will stay again when we return to Singapore. The hotel feels more intimate and smaller (in a good way) than the Marriott or Royal Plaza on Scotts.

Reviews.Title: “2night stopover in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: LondonMajordomo
Reviews.Content: Only small criticisms are ,on arrival had to go looking for porter.Long wait to check in. Room was spacious and very clean.excellent selection at the buffet breakfast both western and oriental dishes, smiling willing service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but would look for another hotel on my next visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a pleaent stay at the york singapore the location is great however the room service staff is a bit rude, though the food at the hotel is good Also when we reached the hotel there was no body at the main entrance to take out our luggage from the taxi, to which the taxi guy also said BAD SERVICE overall we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Fair priced hotel near Mt. Elizabeth Hospital”
Reviews.Author: Grafula
Reviews.Content: I had to undergo some examinations at the Mt. Elizabeth hospital in Singapore. Therefore I was looking for a hotel close by. Agoda offered a good rate at the York hotel so I booked it, The hotel is a bit run down and frequented by group tourists for all parts of the world. Everything is as efficient as one expects in Singapore, but without much "heart". Everything is strictly business. Initially I booked 5 days but had to extend for another 5 days because the examinations took longer than planed. I could not extend straight at the hotel, but had to go through Asiarooms this time (Agoda did not offer the York for that time period). Rate was about the same as through Agoda. Internet access is not included in the rate. They have wifi in the hotel, but the charge is quite high. (I bough an M1 Sim card for my USB modem in Lucky Plaza) PROs: Close to Mt. Elizabeth hospital. Close to Orchard Rd. CLose to Scotts Rd. Close to MRT station (Orchard) CONs: a bit run down. TV offers only a few chanels

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel close to sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: lizj1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night stay and it was amazing, the hotel looks a bit dated but the room was stunning, clean and service was great, the buffet is great with a heap of variety. This hotel is great for local sightseeing and u are right in the centre of orchard rd. would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & burn some calories : )”
Reviews.Author: Dalimartha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite old looking from the outside, but it's good from the inside. We stayed a few times in this hotel due its close to the Orchard. Service is good, needs improvement for the room design. Well I read some bad reviews regarding hilly location however please take a look on the bright side : -After having meals and food Atria, Ice with bread along the Orchard, Ice the Tarik at Kopitiam, and Starbucks well it's a good point to burn the calories on the way back right ? hehe..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation close to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: One is always wary of hotels one is directed to for 24 hour stopovers. The York Hotel proved to e an excellent place to spend 24 hours in Singapore and it was an added bonus that the hotel offered a 50% discount for all à la carte meals taken in the hotel. Food was pretty good too. The swimming pool was refreshing and a decent size and depth for the obligatory swim in Singapore temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel for Family”
Reviews.Author: Alfredo B
Reviews.Content: First time in this hotel. Stayed in the Family Room (New Tower) and was very good. Room really big and confortable. Bathroom clean. Pool area is very nice and good for small childrena as well as youth. Fitness center very nice. Good location. Only 6 minutes walk to ION Orchad, Wheelock Place and other good areas. Did not use the restaurant but looks good from outside. Friendly staff always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ella1971
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 12 night stay at the York Hotel over the Christmas/New Year period. We had booked this hotel based on the fact that it could accomodate our family of 4 in one room (2 queen size beds), and the fact that it was within our budget of AUD$300 per night (it was $285 per night during peak period). After we booked it through our travel agent, I started to become a bit concerned when reading some of the reviews on here. But, it was already booked and paid for, so I just had to hope for the best. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. We were given one of the larger rooms (tip : the rooms on the corner on the floors are bigger - we had room 623), which was nice given the fact that I had to live in one room with my husband and two boys for 12 nights...lol. I agreed with other reviewers that the service is a bit lacking when it comes to the front desk etc, but I believe you do get what you pay for here. The 24 hours room service was very speedy and the menu quite extensive. Orchard Road was an easy walk, with the MRT a couple of minutes further. We stayed at the Novotel Clarke Quay the last time we were in Singapore, and I much preferred the York's location to that of the Novotel. In summary, the next time I visit Singapore I will be trying to squeeze my budget a bit more to stay somewhere a bit more upmarket, however for those on a budget and who are really only looking for a place to sleep with the basic amenities and close to Orchard Road, then the York Hotel will suit you. Happy travels :)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Poppa49
Reviews.Content: The bed was like concrete otherwise it wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Near Orchard but ...”
Reviews.Author: M1109
Reviews.Content: Good location since it's only a short walk from Orchard Road. The hotel though is on the expensive side considering the poor service. Breakfast is so so. The room they gave us when we checked in wasn't cleaned because when we moved the beds, there were candy wrappers and slippers under it and to think we checked in after 2 p.m. and they took a while before we were given a room though we have made reservations online. Only one bellman for lots of people who were checking in at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: NiketShah11
Reviews.Content: We were here about one month back and i was not happy with the service that was extended to me. Firstly the pricing its a little steep however if you put the location in perspective its fantastic. No more than 5 minute walk to Orchard Road, there is a seven eleven right on the Orchard road where you come out. Most of the tourist buses pick you up from the hotel. There was one little annoying thing, there is a travel desk which is not owned by the hotel and there is one that is.. If you see there is $10 difference in prices with the hotel one being the cheaper. I would recommend taking the sight seeing services from the hotel. The orchard MRT is about 8 minute walk. We were upgraded as we were on our honeymoon and got a really big room that's it, nothing else. The bathroom was nice but looked a little old, the beds were comfortable and the view was just about right. All in all a good experience, but a little steep in terms of pricing but no complaints with the service, ambience and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so near to orchard road”
Reviews.Author: anaest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in York hotel for one night in November for business. We booked directly and the rate quoted was higher than Internet rate, we were told it was because we will be given a bigger room with two queen beds. However it was a short trip for just one night and we won't be in the room much all we need was just two beds to sleep, but we want to make sure it is two beds rather than a king bed. After some negotiation we agreed on a twin bedded room same as Internet rate. We checked in and too our horror it was a king bed, so we called and explained and they said we have to wait a few hours to change room and the mean time we must leave the room immediately without messing up the room. We were both tired after being on duty for twenty four hours the day before followed by a six hours journey to Singapore and really just need a shower and a bed before the function that night. Eventually they gave us a two queen beds room as it was available without having to wait. We had prepared to pay for the more expensive rate but was pleasantly surprised they charged us the original rate agreed upon. The hotel was marketed as orchard road hotel but it was not as close as we thought by walking. The room was large which is rare for a island city hotel. It was clean though slightly dated. The rate is reasonable by Singapore standard.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and close to amenities”
Reviews.Author: mickandmarilyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and were more than comfortable. We had access to Orchard Road (which was important!!) and we took advantage of the pool when it was too hot. The food was good, service was excellent and(as it was our anniversary while we were there) we were given a chocolate cake which was very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the service they provide”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro_B
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family (wife and son) for 5 days. It is ok if you are planning to use taxis, otherwise please consider Mount Elizabeth (surrounded by apartment complexes and a close by hospital) is around a 10 minute walk to Orchard MRT (it seemed longer returning to the hotel after sightseeing). For (supposedly) a 4 star hotel, the toilet paper quality is from the dollar store. Hated that you are required to go through the restaurant to access the elevators. The fact that you are required to use your card key to use the elevator seems like a security issue, but it is not floor related (so anyone that shares the elevator can get to any floor). If they have a party (wedding or similar) beware, depending on your location the cigarette smoke might go to your room. Even if you are (like our case) in the 8th floor. The reception desk were helpful when asking for directions, but on the last day requested a wake-up call and did not get it (need to thank my wife for waking me up and making it to our flight on time). Personally would consider other options rather than returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Chris33wa
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I have stayed here and will again. For a cheaper hotel in Singapore it does not seem cheap when you stay there

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & fair price”
Reviews.Author: gunawan_karnata8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for bussines purpose for 2 nights. I reserved this hotel through booking.com for superior twin bed, but when I check in, my room upgraded to family room with very spacious room and 3 bed. The room very well maintained. The pool is ok. The location is good, just about 5 to 10 minutes to orchard road. One thing that I dislike with this hotel is only the reception section. Too slow and busy to talk with another staff there. But I salute with the white rose cafe personel, they very charming and efficient. But overall I am satisfied with this hotel because what I have more compared with I've paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Gaylebs
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the York Hotel. We stayed for 4 nights. Only about a 10 minute walk to Orchard Road. The rooms were a good size. It wasn't cheap but being at Singapore Grand Prix time that is what I expected. Great variety at breakfast. The pool was a nice size and a nice outdoor area. Friendly staff who are always happy to assist. I would definately recommend the York Hotel and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: VictorG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in mid September 2011 with our family; two adults and two children aged 15 & 12. The hotel is in a pretty good location, about 10 minutes walk from the middle of Orchard Rd. From the outside the hotel does look a bit tired. We booked over the internet and had no real problems. Paid AUS$615 for two nights. The room we booked was a premier room with a king bed plus 2 single beds, and the room itself was large enough for four people plus luggage, with room to spare, we didn't feel restricted at all. The room had a large flat-screen TV but no cable - normal free-to-air Singapore TV only has four channels to choose from! We stayed on the 17th floor, and the room was very quiet from any street noise and surrounding rooms; think there was only six rooms on the floor. There was a good sized bathroom with a shower over the bath. The wall mounted hair dryer wasn't very efficient (but when ever are they?) There were tea & coffee facilities, complimentry water, iron and safe. There is a small gym with enough equipment to keep most people happy, but if there were more than five people, it would be getting a bit crowded. There is also an outdoor pool and a spa; but the spa wasn't very hot when I used it at 7.30 AM. Didn't eat in the restaurant, but from the number of people there and the smells, the food did look good and a quick check of the menus, wasn't that expensive either. Being so close to Orchard Rd, there is not a great need to eat in the hotel as there is a huge variety of places to eat less than a 20 minute walk away. If you wanted to explore further, and try some of the hawker centres, then grab a cab and head out and about. Taxis are cheap and not that hard to find most of the time. Yes I would recommend this hotel for a short stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK IT IF YOU WILL NEED INTERNET”
Reviews.Author: antonioperezjr
Reviews.Content: If you will need Internet, choose another hotel. It takes almost one hour for someone to bring to your room the username and pass. Apart that, It's extremaly expensive and slooooow.. Also, each half an hour you will need to re-enter a looooong username and password. I've been traveling throughout many cities in many countries and I have never been so stressed due the (expensive and bad) Internet. The hotel location is good, but it's expensive at all, I would rate it as an average 3 stars hotel. And they say it's reformed, actually it is, but only outside and in the lobby. Inside the rooms the forniture is old.

Reviews.Title: “Hurrah for the bellmen..and ONLY the bellmen!”
Reviews.Author: GyPsYs0uL
Reviews.Content: It's the "real" help that made my stay here worthwhile. I had to move from this hotel to their 'sister" hotel Goodwoods because they could not accommodate me for my second night of a five night stay. No apologies, nothing gratis, had to move two rather LARGE suitcases back and forth from my room to the lobby, to storage, onto the other hotel, and then back again. If it weren't for the bellmen at this would have been completely inconceivable. When staying in a hotel we tend to forget the "little guys" don't we? Try not to on your next stay. Thank the maid, tip the bell captain. They are the ones who are usually the most courteous...and in this case--the only reason why I give a thumbs down to management..and a THUMBS up to the "little guy' who works much harder!

Reviews.Title: “Short Singapore Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne m
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the York Hotel with my father and sister in a triple room I had booked on the internet. We arrived very early (7.30am) and our room was not ready (understable) however when I checked again at 9.30am our room was ready and we were given a free upgrade to a deluxe triple room. The room was a large L shape with a king bed at one end and two singles at the other. The bathroom was very nice and we were really happy with the upgrade. Breakfast was included in the price we paid and the buffet was varied with both western and asian food available and with omlette or fried eggs cooked on request. We also tried the restaurant one night for dinner and found the food good and the prices reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, big rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: inky353
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights in a deluxe room with 2 teenage kids. Big room - must have been 40m2 with 2 king singles plus 1 king bed, 2 lounge chairs, desk, and still plenty of room no tripping over each other and stacks of storage. Air conditioning worked a treat - very comfortable. Gowns and complimentary slippers were a hit. Mini bar tad expensive but not surprised. Singapore free to air tv is awful so would have been appropriate to have free selected satellite tv or a dvd player. Nice fresh fluffy towels and remade beds every day. Good pool but still amazed that it has to close @ 7 pm - would have been nice to dive in to cool off, temperature doesn't really drop much in the evenings. Great location, handy to Orchard MRT, shopping centres, plenty of nearby food courts - with breakfast SGD$30++ pp we elected to eat out. All in all, good 4 star hotel in a good location and wasn't bad value in a country where accommodation isn't cheap. If only the pool stayed opened......

Reviews.Title: “Massive Room!!”
Reviews.Author: LesleyV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the York Hotel for three nights for the Singapore Grand Prix with my family and it was awesome. We arrived early at 11 o'clock (their website says check in is from 2) and our room wasn't ready yet which we expected anyway, they told us to come back at 1 o'clock so we left our bags in a secure area and went out shopping for a few hours. We came back at one and both our rooms were ready and to our surprise we had been upgraded. We had booked two deluxe rooms and were given two premier rooms. These were something else. The biggest hotel room I have ever slept in. 50sqm. There were two singles pushed together and a king size bed. Walk in wardobe and a bathroom with two sinks and a shower over the bath. I had three wonderful nights sleep... didn't hear a thing from any other rooms and we were on the 16th floor. Only thing that woke me up was the massive thunderstorm on the Sunday night... the thunder shook the room!! We got settled and headed down to the pool area which is located at the back of reception, past the restaurant. The pool is a nice enough size, clean and plenty of sunbeds as it was surprisingly quiet. It was quite shaded by trees though so to get the sun you have to position your sunbed.There are towels provided which are located in a little reception area you walk past to get to the pool. To order food and drinks there is a phone provided next to where you get the towels. If you dial "2" you will be put through to the restaurant upstairs and order what you want and they bring it to the poolside for you. There is also a drinks menu and food menu provided beside the phone although not a cocktail menu but just ask which cocktails they have. We had Singapore Slings and they were very nice. We never had food though so can't comment on this. The hotel is located near Mount Elizabeth Hospital about a 5 minute walk to orchard road near the rolex and mui mui shops. The staff were very friendly and informative and we couldn't fault the hotel at all... would definitely consider York Hotel for staying in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CasinoBpl
Reviews.Content: Not quite on the shopping street .. just a quick stroll down the driveway to the shops. Orchard road, five minutes walk away. The local mall has got everything from 7-11 and KFC to the best dining places. You want local food .. it is there. Thai food is terrific. Up a few levels but well worth the ride on the escalators. Even a Brit Chips place. McDonalds and McCafe are across the street and 50 steps away. The Hotel is top stuff. Change your money at the front desk at best rates. Tours desk in lobby. We were on the 14th floor and it was quiet. No road noise. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't be a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: Lawesyman
Reviews.Content: The location of the York is superb, just minutes away from orchard road. Sadly that's the only positive. Our major gripe is the walls that separate the rooms are paper thin and you can hear everything in the adjoining rooms, especially if your room has a connecting door. We switched rooms three times ( we we only there 3 nights) each were adequately roomy but had a smell of ammonia and some had the hair from previous guests matted in the rugs. Each had visible mould in the bathrooms. The swimming pool is pleasant enough but the spa is cold and the water isn't pleasant. Internet is very expensive. I got a sim card from one of the malls for S$20 which was far cheaper than the hotels slow Internet S$28 for 2 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but is bad 4 star hotel, actually I would say it is an expensive 3 star hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jou_josmar
Reviews.Content: Well, when I did the reservation in Internet I mentioned to please give me a non-smoking room. Wrong!!! they put me in the 7th floor that has a spread out and intense smoking smell. At least we moved later to another room. From the from desk to the lifts you must pass in front of the cafeteria and it is better to hold you breath because there is a very strong smell of several combinations of food that is very annoying for a hotel entrance. The rest is okay, for few days you can manage the situation. Actually the 2 advntages of this hotel is the cost and location. Particularly, for a good 4 to 5 star hotel in S'pore you most pay USD 230 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money, but NOT for people with allergies!”
Reviews.Author: Orchid24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the York hotel with my husband, it was our first time to Singapore, and we used most of our time for sight-seeing. I stayed in a Superior room. The hotel is a good value for money, comfortable beds, good condition of baths, very cold everywhere (temperature-wise!)… Probably because Singapore is all so wet and warm outside, and everybody tries to create some cool comfort for foreigners in closed areas… However, I believe they overdo it, as one may get a shock temperature coming form outside and entering the “refrigerator”. Food for breakfast is good, service is excellent – based on the expectations you form for a city hotel (not based on a 5-star hotel service comparison!). Overall - good hotel. Greatest advantage – LOCATION. It has a perfect location, just off the Orchard road with all the shops, malls, cafes… Very close to the bus station in front of Marriott hotel nearby, very convenient… Money changers near at Lucky Plaza, even a Small supermarket (On Scotts Road). The greatest disadvantage – no balconies, at all. And, I honestly do not know if this applies for all rooms, or something was wrong with ours, but windows do not open – they are locked! So…. Yes, it is cool in the room, but… I would advise people with allergies not to select this hotel! For everybody else – take it for the great location, and for its good value for money! Smokers – have in mind, that given there are no balconies, no windows that open, and a non-smoking policy, you can only smoke outside, at a place called “smoking garden” which is actually just a ground with an ashtray located around 5-7meters from the entrance of the hotel as per local policies!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: JarredH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in August 2011 with wife and 3yo son. Check in was reasonably quick 10 min all up We had a Deluxe room booked but when we walked in it only had a King bed. Our travel agent had booked a room with 2 Queens. Went to reception and got moved to the correct room straight away. Room was clean and had plenty of space for my son to play around. Your also a 5 min walk ( down hill, up hill with shopping isn't that fun ) from Orchard Rd which has malls everywhere, Paragon is the closest to the hotel. The only issues I had with the hotel was, firstly you could hear the people in the room above stomp around, even worse when it was kids running around like we had, I stopped my son from jumping around to spare the room below us. Secondly I wasn't impressed with the breakfast compared to the likes of the KLIA Pan Pacific where we stayed before here, selection wasn't the best but I was happy that they had Pork Bacon after spending time in KL. Overall the hotel was clean & in a great location close to food & shopping. Would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in an expensive city'”
Reviews.Author: bek_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore on our way to Thailand from Dec 30 2010 to Jan 3 2011. After trawling through many booking sites and reading reviews on TA we decided to book a Tower Suite at the York Hotel through booking.com. Many of the hotels tend to be on the expensive side (for what you get) - upwards of $250 SGD per night. My husband had stayed at The York for business a year earlier and was very happy with the room and the service. We booked a Tower Suite which was extremely large (most hotel rooms in Singapore tend to be on the smaller side). It was very clean, airy and had everything you'd expect from a standard hotel. The service from the staff was helpful, courteous, friendly and very efficient. On the first night I found the bed to be extraordinarily hard (and I usually love hard mattresses), however this was very quickly rectified by reception organising a mattress protector/cover which made a huge difference. All the facilities were of very good standard, I used the gym daily and my son loved the outdoor pool. The buffet breakfast had a large selection of food and again was of a very high standard. The hotel is in walking distance to Orchard Road and like everything in Singapore a short distance away by taxi. If we return to Singapore we would stay at the York again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: alohacjm
Reviews.Content: The York Hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, but still close to the MRT and shopping and restaurants. A short seven minute walk downhill gets a guest to Orchard Avenue and two malls. Add five more minutes of walking and a main MRT station is right there. The rooms in the hotel are comfortable, clean and roomy. If other guests tend to be loud, their voices can be heard in the next room, but when this happened to me, I was immediately offered a room change, and upgraded to a wonderful suite. The restaurant has a great varied breakfast, and, if a person books the early bird reservations, daily breakfast is included. Dinners are reasonable priced and tasty. Each month the restaurant offers ten dishes at $12.00 each, and, for those meals, a person can get a dessert at half price. Just don't order the ice tea! There are no refills and each glass is $7.00. The hotel could improve by having a ice machine and drink machine on each floor. Right now they don't have either at the hotel, at all.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible”
Reviews.Author: Alex w
Reviews.Content: The twin room beds are only big enough if you are 1-6 years old. After a two day wait for a tiny double bed to become available, I was greeted with a omnipresent smell of ammonia, so strong it made my eyes water. All they could offer was two sprays from an air-freshener, just making the smell more complex and layered. The worst factor wasn't the tiny concrete bed, or the very tired and stains decor, but the internet connection. No cable option, just the weakest wifi service available, one that kept dropping to zero making it impossible to connect. If you have emails/work to do from your room, do not stay here. I had two failed presentations due to not being able to access email or gather info on the web. 30 minutes to download one email. Impossible business location. Positives..... the breakfast is good once you get through the queue (the hotel doesn't provide enough seating in the lobby to cater for the 200+ rooms. The room service menu is very varied and fast service. Overall, not what you'd expect from a Singapore business hotel (SD$230+ a night). Tired and in need of renovation, especially the I.T infrastructure. Sadly the hotels marketing is modern and impressive, but once you get up close and personal, you'll be disappointed and frustrated. I hope they will upgrade the hotels potential to match 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - good value”
Reviews.Author: Fredo321
Reviews.Content: I had spacious Premier Room, which was newly refurbished and made a very good impression. The TV program is very limited and you may want to have some movies on your notebook (or better a good book), otherwise the evenings will become quite boring. Internet is free. Breakfast is average, pool as well, but sufficient. The gym is tiny and crowded so may not be able to follow your training schedule, when you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little overpriced (Compared 2 service)”
Reviews.Author: Baland
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights with my wife. I will keep this short: Pros: Great location, good spacious rooms, good amenities, good buffet food though slightly high compared to any decent meal u can have outside the hotelok service level, separate desk for tourists' inquiries and assistance, will stay there again if I am in Singapore. Cons: A little overpriced cuz for that price u would expect something better, staff - including front desk n restaurant - need to b friendlier a bit, n more organized when it comes to receiving people upon their arrival cuz they tend to be confused a bit. All in all, it is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for MRT and orchard rd, seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: Maximuslonghaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with family in adjoining rooms 24th-27th July. Whilst the rooms were 'adequate' they had definetly seen better days. Bathrooms in need of a refurb. Good location 5 mins from orchard rd MRT and 15 mins from Newton circus hawker market. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast was fine but had to queue for eggs. Pool was good but not enough loungers. Adequate for a couple of nights if you're passing through but not for anything longer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location , value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: smst83
Reviews.Content: The only hotel around orchard road with a reasonably family room since we're travelling with in a group of 4. Orchard road is just less than 10 mins walking distance. The room could fit 3 more people. The only downside is that the road towards the hotel is uphill. And the shortest way to access the hotel from orchard road is up the road in between Tangs and Lucky plaza

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Convenient for Orchard Road shopping”
Reviews.Author: OrchidWales_UK
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the York Hotel. Twice on Business and once on holiday. The staff are most helpful. The rooms are spacious and well kept. The restaurant caters for several nationalities. Breakfast is good and plentiful. The main shopping area of Orchard Road is a mere 5 minutes walk away. Taxis are plentiful. This time I had a package of breakfast and computer broadband for about £118 per night, which for such a hotel in Singapore is good. The hotel has a small swimming pool with adjacent changing rooms, which are kept spotlessly clean .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: tip2p
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel in walking distance of the Orchard Road. We had a large family room and could not fault anything. The breakfast buffet was particulary good. But as any mid range hotel in Singapore still expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and value.”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYAUSIE
Reviews.Content: After a long flight back from London it was wonderful to check into this very conveniently located, clean, comfortable and quiet hotel. Staff are helpful and friendly and our wondrful large corner room was spotless. A short walk had us amongst all the action in Orchard Road and Paragon Plaza...a shoppers paradise. We have visited Singapore many times and stayed in different hotels each visit but the York is definitely in for a revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Chillipeppa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and has been revamped although it is dated, it is still a comfortable place to be in for a short stay. It is a short walk down the hill to Orchard Road so very convenient for shopping trips.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the central loation”
Reviews.Author: JonBrisbane
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the York for 5 days, one before our cruise and 4 after the cruise. On both occasions, the check in was fast and without issue. On our first arrival, we got in very early.6am, we were able to have our room at 8:30am, way before the official check in time, we thought it was great. The room we had was very large as there were 4 of us. There was a king bed and 2 singles for the kids, there was still plenty room to run around. The bathroom was roomy too with a full bath and 2 hand basins, very posh! It is just a 5 mins walk to Orchard Road and Scotts Road where all the shops and businesses around, very handy with the MRT station and buses very closeby.Taxi is not too bad too and if you are first timer into Singapore, taxi fare from the hotel to most attractions was around $10. For 4 of us, it was just as cheap to use taxi and not having to worry about where to get on and off with the public transport. Breakfast was included which was very good, it altered daily although the basic was the the same, we like the freshly cooked omlettes cooked to order! We also treated oursleves to their Sunday Hightea as well, it was fabulus, no dinner that night! The pool area was good although it was basic, it was enough to cool us down, was really plasant. Will stay there again if we ever visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: WHiranya
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there for two nights in two rooms, the very first impression was pretty much horrible...no bell boy came to get our luggages but the staff at the front desk was adequate. There was no free internet but that was not a problem, but not what I expected from a 4-star hotel. So I bought the internet package, and was given a hand-written username and password written by the front desk, and the letters were illegible. I usually get a pre-paid card with the username and password printed on it from all the hotels I have been...seeing this hand-written note on a piece of paper was a first for me, so I had to call the front desk and they told me to contact the "operator" and ask for the IT person. Then the internet worked but it was extremely slow, so I had to call the operator again and they said they will increase the bandwidth for me and told me to wait for 10 minutes, but it was still slow beyond belief. They have high speed LAN internet available but they do not provide us with the cable and told us to bring it ourselves. The overall of the room was great, I did not expect to get a big closet with iron, although it was quite outdated, including the bathroom and the room did not look like as advertised on their website. Each room came with a complementary 1.5Liter bottled water and some instant coffee and water boiler. However the second room did not come with instant coffee nor the water boiler. The next day we did not get a new bottled water, so we called the front desk and they said bottled water is only for "one stay", and it costs SG$8++ to buy one. The breakfast did not have much of a variety, not worth the price we paid for, the fruit was not fresh at all and had a bad smell. In conclusion, this hotel should be rated as a 3 star hotel despite its location.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: scotland020
Reviews.Content: hotel was alright,good location,not far from orchard road room was big but bathroom was small,breakfast staff were nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location....”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSingapore
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel, average level of service but in a good location. I stayed here in a visit of a relative who was hopitalized in Mount Elisabeth Hospital which was only a block away from the hotel. The lobby was renovated to give a modern feeling which turned out good. Breakfast buffet was okay in terms of taste and variety. But, the rooms were old. Beds were like centuries old. Bathrooms were basic. Don't expect any fancy experience if you want to stay in this hotel but location is good if you bant to be close to Mount Elisabeth Hospital or even Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JEQC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in this great location. Very clean , big room, and pleasant helpful staff. We didnt eat at the hotel as you can walk abut 5 minutes to many small cafes, breakfast spots, and a few more minutes to the hawker stalls in the Food Republic. It is located just off the "top"of Orchard Road and is very convenient to all the shops, the subway station and yet is quiet and peaceful. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms here if you get an upgrade like I did”
Reviews.Author: Pippa953
Reviews.Content: The York is a nice older style hotel set a little way back from Orchard Rd.It only takes 5 minutes to walk down to where all the action is happening. I was there for 3days during which there was a heat wave. The pool was very inviting at this time. We got an upgrade and the room was really huge and made for a great start to our holiday.. concierge was very helpful for organising tours etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: handancer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the York for 5 nights in Oct after 8 nights in Phuket. My boyfriend has proposed to me in Phuket and was telling the young man about it as we were checking in. He congratulated us then told us that he had upgraded our room so we were taken to a huge room with a enormous bed, separate lounge/sitting area and just generally alot of living space so it just felt nicer. Room was clean, great bathroom, good choice of channels on TV and comfy bed. Hotel was a perfect location close to Orchard Rd but can be tough to walk back up hill after lots of shopping. The pool area was a god send! I went straight there after checking in as it was a glorious day and we had not had great weather in Phuket so I soaked up the sun when I could. The best bit, no one was there! I had it all to myself for 3 hours! So I savored this experience for as long as I could! When we were checking out, we had told them that we didn't need to head to the airport till 3 pm so they allowed us a 12pm checkout. Also they suggested to leave suitcases with porter while we could head out for last minute shopping. Upon returning we could use the changerooms in pool area to freshen up and change clothes before heading to airport. This was very helpful and nothing was a problem for them.

Reviews.Title: “Bland, boring, rude staff, cold feeling about the place... :(”
Reviews.Author: LauraL27
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a double room at the York. The location is fantastic, but the hotel itself is very bland, very boring and the staff are abrupt and rude. For the price it was a very basic and old room. The bathroom had stains and watermarks, and the general feel of the place just felt "wrong" - you know what I mean - just a bad feeling about it. It was very clinical and unfriendly. The buffet breakfast was OK, the staff unfriendly. Seriously there was not a smile from anyone the whole time we were there. After coming from the BEST hotel we have ever stayed at (Pacific Club Resort in Phuket) to this place, it was the worst downer imaginable. I would not recommend this place to anyone. For the price we paid it was ridiculous and I would give it a 2 out of 10.... horrible.....

Reviews.Title: “Good service but food lacking”
Reviews.Author: TravlnTwins
Reviews.Content: The York hotel has extremely friendly and good service. Front desk made extra efforts to get a non-smoking room (which was requested in booking) at 2.30am arrival, and upgraded me in order to fulfill request. The restaurant is not a good value. Sing $28 for a very limited buffet breakfast, which is a ridiculous price. They cannot even make omelettes with cheese (claim the cheese sticks to the well-oiled non-stick pan!). Unless breakfast included in room rate, skip the hotel restaurant and visit one of the multiple food outlets in short walking distance - many food courts in local malls offer quite good selections. 24 hour Starbucks also a short walk away for an early morning breakfast. Very strange but they also will not provide ice unless you pay $3.50. Beds are quite firm, in the Asian style. Rooms are a bit dated but quite clean. Location is just off Orchard road, and also convenient to the MRT station. Taxis are also plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: chefgoosegirl
Reviews.Content: Didn't expect much from this hotel especially based on the reviews. We were given a room at a non-smoking floor but the hallway really smelled of smoke! Our room was small, tv was old with very few channels, bathroom needs a facelift. No free bottled water, slippers & toothbrushes. About 8-10 minutes walk to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Richo12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the York Hotel for 1 night in March, 2011. I found the hotel staff very good and I was very happy with the size and cleanliness of the room. Also enjoyed the breakfast and also had lunch in the cafe - very nice at a reasonable price. The York is only a 5 minute walk (downhill) to Orchard Road, so has great access to shopping, restaurants and night life.

Reviews.Title: “No Service with No Smile”
Reviews.Author: travelling_sister
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the room wasnt ready so we left our bags and went to the Zoo (which is great by the way). When we arrived back we checked in and our room only had 2 singles and a sofa bed. After speaking with reception they decided they would give us another single bed at no charge. There were not enough towels, toilet paper or tissues. At check out there was an issue with my credit card. Whilst trying to establish what the problem was, the woman at reception has zero tolerance and zero patience and was quite rude. It was our experience the concierge, security guards, door men and reception staff had no customer service skills what so ever. I must say that the location is fantastic and about a 5 minute walk to the MRT and Orchard Rd shopping malls. But the location wouldnt be enough for me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: huaymeeng
Reviews.Content: this is the cheapest hotel in the Orchard area, about $200 - $300. Good location, MRT station (Orchard) is just a couple minutes of walking distance, surrounded with shopping malls - Takashimaya, ION. Frontdesk is friendly, and helpful, no problem checking in. I got a cabana room, very spacious (the room look empty though), bathroom is small in comparison with the room size. no complimentary internet, hotel charge quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to start a honeymoon"”
Reviews.Author: Patrickm73
Reviews.Content: I was a bit scared after reading tsome of the reviews, but it is a great hotel. we got upgraded without asking to a cabana room at the pool side and it was fantastic with a good aircon, you need one. the food was good in the mornings and the service was great. the hotel is close to Orchard street and shopping is great, we used the underground and got everywhere rel fast. it was great everything is so clean and it works. the taxi's are cheap and friendly if you need touse them. make sure you visit Santosa Island it is worth the trip. the food is good in most places and VERY clean. this is one place you have to visit and no better hotel to stay in other than the York Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not much”
Reviews.Author: djtravelbug
Reviews.Content: Rooms - rooms are OK but even if we were in a non-smoking level, just outside of the room smells smoke already so I'm not sure how they monitor the "non-smoking" level policy. Items in the rooms were OK like soap, shampoo, dental kit, etc. Free Wi-fi as well. Location - this is the main reason why we chose this hotel, the office of our partners in Singapore is just walking distance. Also, it is 5 minutes walk to the shopping centers such Lucky Plaza(?) and Takashimaya. It is also cost you around maximum of 25 SGD by taxi from the airport. Price - a bit pricey given that this is not a 5 star hotel yet it is priced as such. Service - is just fine. I just needed a place to sleep that's near our Singapore office so I wasn't able to use most of their facilities or avail of their services. I think this hotel is one of the oldest in Singapore and yet still modern. It's just that the price should be a little bit less to justify the amenities and facilities this one offers. There were other hotels with better value.

Reviews.Title: “staff are quite apathic”
Reviews.Author: Fiontse
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, only 5 minute to orchard road. But the staff there is ont sincere enough, they are cool with no smile upon teh check in and out procedure. When I got problem in using the lift, they just explained in few words. Apart from the location, it is no other positive comment could be given.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing ....”
Reviews.Author: FFHMGPD
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was clean and attractive, and the staff were nice. the room that was assigned to us was a superior room with twin beds on the 9th floor...specifically asked for non smoking as we have allergies...however upon entering there was definitely the smell of dust and dampness and the smell of deodorising room spray...it was absolutely terrible the glass window was caked with dust and upon showing it to the duty manager he realised that the housekeeping was at fault. we were moved to one of the cabanas for the same price.. the cabana was better with a lounge at the bottom and the bedroom batroom on top, although near the swimming pool can be noisy and a bit out of the way in the basement..

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: hedlander6722
Reviews.Content: We booked at the York as a place to sleep during a 15hr stopover in Singapore - rather then being stuck at the budget terminal. It was fairly average. The service however was good. We arrived at 2am and didnt need to be a the airport until 4pm so they gave us a later check out time. The room are very small and the bathroom even smaller. No room safe or hair dryer. The only toiletries provided were shampoo, body wash, body lotion and a cake of soap. The room was very hot when we arrived and even though we cranked up the airconditioning, it took ages to cool down. We had an expensive buffet breakfast at the hotel as very few places are open before 10am to buy any food nearby. The breakfast was adequate with a mix of Asian and Western food.They did however have a chef to cook omelettes or fry eggs to order. The best thing about the hotel is the proximity to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Ozjamboree
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed three nights at the York Hotel on a short stopover in Singapore. We had booked this hotel ourselves and were extremely happy with the quality of the room and service that we received. We were travelling with our adult daughter so booked a Family tower room which was quite spacious but a bit disappointing that the single bed was a fold out rather than a normal bed. The hotel is located in a great place just off Orchard Rd and I am a bit puzzled about previous comments relating to the steepness of this hotel. The walk from Orchard Road is a gentle incline and should not trouble most people! The service from the desk staff and concierge/doormen was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to Everything”
Reviews.Author: jklancke
Reviews.Content: The York hotel has a great location, right off the main shopping street in Singapore...Orchard. In addition, it is only a short ride to the main restaurant area...Clarky Quay. With that being said, it is such a small country, you can get anywhere in less than an hour...even with traffic. The rooms were a typical size with good bedding, fairly well updated, and very clean. The service was great...in the restaurant, front desk, housekeeping, laundry, and door men that ran down the street to get cabs before someone else got them. My only suggestion would be to eat outside of the hotel. The local hawker stalls are delicious and a full meal will only cost you a few dollars. In addition, they are all inspected by the government, so they are totally safe. A meal in the hotel will cost you $50+ dollars and is mediocre at best. The best place to eat is at the quay.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly reception yet helpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: sakuraG7
Reviews.Content: I had been in York hotel for 1 week. The checked in was not smooth, because we had problem for the room. And I could see that the receptionists were not professional in handling guest's requests and complaints. They even didn't have the smile which is very needed in hospitality industry. Besides that their intonation were very rude. Luckily, after the bad checked in, our anger subsided with the helpful concierge that offered us a trip to Universal studio which we waited the most. He is an old Chinese man ( I forgot the name), the first person in hotel who was smiling at us. But actually overall, either the concierge or bellmen,were doing a great job. But sorry to say that we will not return to this hotel anymore because of the bad experience at the reception counter.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, but a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AusFamOf4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Tower Suite with our two toddlers, which was extremely spacious - the pictures on their website really are a true indication of the space. We would not normally stay in this type of room, but we booked late and there wasn't much around our price range so bit-the-bullet! Service was very good, the porter was very helpful getting up the stairs at the front and then delivering and collecting our bags on check-in/departure. Housekeeping quickly delivered the baby cot when we arrived (somewhere in the middle of the night after a 9hr flight), and the room-service breakfast was reasonable. The restaurant on the ground floor served a good range of food - our kids loved the spag bol! There were computers in the lobby with reasonably priced (coin-operated) internet access. We caught taxis to where we needed to go, so cannot comment on location. The porters were very helpful in arranging our taxis and an airport transfer for us, and helped us load up all our gear. Overall this was a great hotel for our needs, but was probably the most expensive place we stayed in and the room was definitely much bigger than we are used to!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!! WILL RETURN IN 2011”
Reviews.Author: Speegal
Reviews.Content: Don't believe everything you read!!! This hotel is in a great location about 5-7min walk to Orchard Rd. Hill is so slight I wouldn't call it a hill (gentle slope). We found all staff very helpful and friendly. We checked in at 11pm and staff were very speedy. Stayed in a Tower Family Room which was large compared to other hotels we looked at. We asked for late check out and were given it without hesitation, considering hotel was 95% full we thought this great. Doormen helped with taxis in terms of explaining where we wanted to go and how best to get there. We found taxis cheaper in most cases than MRT. Supermarket located behind hotel (under Far East Plaza) as well as very cheap pasta restaurant. Go to Toast Box at Ion for $2 breakfast and $1.50 cakes. Must do Zoo and Bird Park (didn't like night zoo as animals shy). If looking for fish foot spa this is at entrance to Night Zoo and is cheaper than down town. Ate at Lucky's Plaza food court - very cheap food. If looking for steak go to Aston's (ask hotel). Great food and very reasonable. If going to Sentosa go on shuttle bus (outside Your Singapore on Orchard Rd). $8 return and far cheaper than taxi or MRT. Know your perfume prices - shops at Lucky's Plaza can be cheap depending on dollar exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: BazCranleigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in early December. The hotel is very well situated for the Shopping Centres in Orchard Road and for the Orchard MRT station which links you to many of the attractions of Singapore. The MRT is a cheap, safe and convenient way to explore the city). Although the walk back is slightly uphill the trick is to take it easy without rushing and there should be no undue perspiring! In contrast to some reviewers we found the staff on reception friedly and efficient. A couple of deficiencies in our room (safe not working and the drying line over the bath non-functional) were dealt with very promptly. A similar helpfulness was experienced in the restaurant. Here I sometimes wanted a light meal and a request for an omelette (not on the menu) was willingly granted on more than one occasion. Our room (315) was of reasonable size for the grade of hotel, although due for a face-lift around the bath. Housekeeping kept the room very clean. Room 315 is, however, immediately opposite the lifts and we were disturbed one night by a noisy group returning very late (or early in the morning). One area of improvement would be to replace the stained carpet in the communal area outside the lifts - that would give a better initial impression of the hotel. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “High Price with Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: dwichy
Reviews.Content: Actually, they have very good location, clean and big room. But,the staff unhelpful. We carry our language by our self while the bell man just stand and looking at us upon check inn. I call to reception asking some information about the hotel,but they ask us to call to operator not to them. What a poor service? they claim they are 4 star hotel? i don't think so they are is. Every time we came from outside to lobby, the bell man never try to help open the door for us even though they see we have a lot of shopping bags in our hand. Very disappointing when we found at evening our room not make up yet since we request and put the sign in the morning. I need to call housekeeping for the tooth brush and paste. I definitely will not come back to this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “average price at good location”
Reviews.Author: kltravelboy
Reviews.Content: I was browsing through the net for some good deals for hotels around Orchard Road, finally found a travel website that had a good deal for this hotel. what makes this hotel perfect is its just right in the center of Orchard Road, it just minutes away from all the shopping malls. Room has all the basic amenities and its clean.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and Loud”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveler078
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few blocks from Orchard St but that is the only good thing about it. The hotel smells musty and moldy. The bathroom was awful - the tiles were dirty and the bathtube didn't drain when taking a shower. I do not recommend this hotel - location or not.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious quality Stay with city shopping”
Reviews.Author: JodeeP
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, had alot of space, excellent service and great food. We stayed here before we went on our cruise. The service desk provided us with the best taxi and transport service. They also held our luggage when we arrived early and let us change. Very spacious rooms, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: TONY_TravelLover
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Deluxe rooms for two nights. We were quite disappointed with the rooms appearance since the rooms look quite "empty", big difference from the room presentation on their website. Location is not good as it requires about 15 mins on foot from the nearest Orchard MRT station. The service is very poor. It took us almost 20 mins just for check in which supposed to be simple. The worst is we noticed "discrimination" on their services. The way their staff treated us or other Asian guests are totally opposite from American / European guests. American/European guests are treated with smile and friendly talk while we always see unwelcome faces. We traveled quite a lot around the world but never receive such offended services.

Reviews.Title: “ีUnder Expectation”
Reviews.Author: AndannanN
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is OK but I think they should improve their services such as check-in process.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service. Need to imporve a lot”
Reviews.Author: Tzazen
Reviews.Content: Bad perception with many staff from day one when checked in til the last meal there. We think we deserved more quality service and some smile from this hotel staff especially at the breakfast. The hotel is not quite near Orchard shopping area, you still need some walking exercise to the arcade.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alhan
Reviews.Content: Despite its an old hotel, it is newly renovated. But some types of the rooms are not, so make sure you check before you booked. The LCD that shows in the hotel website are fake though, rooms (superior) that we've got are both with old box TV. Location is OK, you need to walk for 10minutes to get to Orchard road/ MRT station, a little uphill back to hotel (not recommended for older people) The staffs are not the nicest people in the world, but helpful enough when needed. Plus point for cleanliness (maybe since it newly renovated) Minus point is no water bottle compliment. Nothing really to complaint about, at same time nothing so fabulous either. I wouldn't rate it as 4 star hotel. 3 or 3,5 star max :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moumar81
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very near to shopping, restaurant, train/metro, & restaurant & night life. The hotel is nice & clean. The customer service was nice & get us to our room with no problem. The free breakfast buffet was delicious & it have everything you need from chicken sausage to ham & pancake & waffle. Singapore is a very beautiful country with a lot to see & discover. Take the metro & go all over the island.

Reviews.Title: “huge room, clean, real close to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: welingtonanna
Reviews.Content: Would totally recommend. Staff very pleasant. Very close to all the excitement of Orchard Road. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family room but unprofessional recptionist”
Reviews.Author: bizarre98
Reviews.Content: Stay in the family room here last year. Check in and out was slow, rude and not polite receptionist. Management should recruits new staff. Swimming pool closed early and they said we cant use it due to security reason, even we have to see the manager. 1st time we heard it after travelling so much around for years. So really disappointed. I won't recommend this hotel and it should be rated much lower.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and easy access to MRT stations and shopping centres”
Reviews.Author: PrasadSharjah
Reviews.Content: Little expensive and they mustimprove the front office service. Quality of furnitures ok but the coat provided to my childrens was very old and need repair or replacement. The fridge in room very small and no space to keep even water bottles. TV very old model of 21" not the LCD one as they mentioned in their ads. We had to rush outside everyday in the morning for the breakfast and even drinking water, which was not provided free issue. Swimming pool timing were limited, so we could not use it in our 5 days stay.

Reviews.Title: “not worth a 4 star this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tammiKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: the receptionist was not polite. was told there's no non-smoking room with queen bed. all have twin beds only. basic necessities like lotion, toothbrush, comb or bathrobe not provided in this 4 star hotel. would never return. there are many other better 4 star hotels with similar room rates in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “tried to fob me off”
Reviews.Author: itsallgreat
Reviews.Content: Booked a Cabana room for 5 nights, when I checked in they said nothing about not having my room and tried to fob me off with a different room without even telling me. To be fair I then spoke with the manager and he sorted us out with a 100mtr suite so could not complain as it was a much better room than we booked. The staff could do with some smiles can't be a great place to work! Our room maid was however very good and friendly. I did not like the fact there is no bar in the hotel you have to sit in the dining room for drinks? The place was very clean and the location was fantastic the walk down to Orchard road was nothing not sure what others are moaning about. I used the gym which was ok but only 1 bench aircon was good and very clean and tidy, the pool was nice and clean. A lovely lady in the hotel shop pity the rest of the staff were not like her. So overall a nice hotel but more a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms and clean, nasty front-desk.”
Reviews.Author: KatherineSJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at a street off Orchard Rd. It takes approx. 15 min. brisk walking to the center of the attractions (Takashimaya, Ion, etc). We book 3 rooms with breakfast. The rooms are clean and spacious enough (compare to other Singapore hotels). Now, the bad part. The front desk personnels are nasty. They asked us to provide all the guests' ID's/passports, including my son (13 years old), my niece (10 years old), my nephews (8 & 9 years old), my mom (69), and sister. Can you believe that? Consequently, It took forever to check in !!!! When I protested, they answered in not so nice tone that it is company's policy. The breakfast is below average and overpriced (S $25/person). Extra bed : S $75 without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PatsyRBangkok
Reviews.Content: Walk down and you will be at Paragon on Orchard Rd. in 7 minutes. Unbeatable location. The hotel doesn't pretend to be more than it is, a 4-star hotel. We stayed in the Deluxe Family Room, which was a basic hotel room with 2 queen size beds and lots of empty space so you don't bump into each other when there are 4 of you in the room. I found the staff quite friendly and polite compared to other places in Singapore. They were fully booked and busy on all the days we were there, yet they managed to stay pleasant and helpful. Book your Universal Studios tickets at the concierge desk (NOT the tour desk at the car park entrance) as they will direct you to a tour company that gives you free transportation. You pay only for your entrance tickets, which was great because tickets were sold out that day if you did not reserve in advance. We did not try the food there as there were so many options nearby, even late at night. Walk to Scotts Rd. using the car park access through Goodwood Hotel and there is a 24-hour Starbucks and Mc Donald's (do you really want that Big Mac at 1 am?) on the opposite side of the road. A farther walk down to 313 Somerset and there is another 24-hour coffee shop. Our only gripes are the ridiculous price they charge for wireless internet connection and the rooms can use a bit more sound insulation. You can hear when people are talking in the hall and when those in the room above are using the bath. It would also help if the staff could monitor the guests who bring in durians! The smell was awful though their air filter seems to have taken care of it after a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location :)”
Reviews.Author: NuttyNutt
Reviews.Content: I have wrote a review for Elizabeth hotel before which is just opposite this hotel, so basically, the location is the same. Great, as its just 5 minutes walk down the hill, but maybe 8 minutes up :) So location is definitely great, just behind paragon, which is off Orchard Street, so easy for shoppers. We took a Tower Suite, which is in the main block. They only have 4 suites per floor, which is just great ! Room size is huge. We took 2 tower suites connecting , with one king size bed and the other twin single beds. But both rooms have sofa bed, which is a hit with the kids for them to bunk around. With big room size, my toddler had fun running around. With the sitting area, is just nice to sit after a day shopping. Bathroom is spacious too, which made it all great.
