Pool is equally, as we only used it once, to ease of the heat after being out-door. Bellman, the concierge were great staffs, very helpful especially when they see you puffing up the hill to get back to the hotel. So it helped my liking too. Overall, a reasonable hotel, better than Elizabeth hotel, should you take this Tower Suite rooms.....

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Springstreet77
Reviews.Content: After reading all the comments about unhelpful and rude desk staff I was pleased to note that when we arrived around midnight, the staff were pleasant, smiling and helpful. They greeted my baby with enthusiasm. All was good. Our room was huge by Singapore standards. We had a cabana room. I had requested this based on another reviewers comments. It was located near the pool which was good. The TV in our room was located in a strange position so you couldn't really watch easily in bed and the other gripe I had was the stairs - no ramp - at the entrance. The staff were helpful in assisting us with the baby pram but there are a lot of stairs. The walk to Orchard Rd is not really pleasant as the hill is quite steep. We ate at the restaurant and the food and service were good. We came back to Singapore a week or so later and did not stay at the York again. The Carlton Hotel was a similar price so we stayed there and preferred the location - not so busy, close to Raffles, Chimes etc. We were also upraded there and had a geeat room. I would stay at The York again but it is never going to be more than it is - a basic 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “sad experience”
Reviews.Author: sanjaygrover402
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at this Hotel and except for the centralized location and the concierge desk of the hotel ( I was impressed the way the gentlemen packed by belongings in a corrugated box , covered the box brown paper , tied it with a rope and it just looked like a gift box ) there is nothing good. The check-in took me 45 minutes even there was a confirmation number available. The staff the check-in counter was not trained and had to consult for every step. The training cannot be on the job as you have people as you have guests who have spent hours in flight and would like to relax in the room. This was not enough, when I went into the room I was surprised to know that the hotel does not even offer complimentary bottles of water. Take it from the mini bar or get it from outside was the blunt reply given. I never called the room service the next three days. I would think twice before I decide to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: aquajade
Reviews.Content: The deluxe family room was big enough for our family of 3 adults and 2 kids (aged 4 & 10). We got the room at SGD285 inclusive of breakfast for 3 adults. There were 2 queen size beds and the room was large and comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet area and less than 5 minutes walk from the bustling Orchard Rd. I couldn't fault the service - whatever I requested was given in a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynette27
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for 5 nights on our way back from Hong Kong. This is the 3rd time we have stayed here & we've never had any problems. The room was a standard room yet had plenty of space & was bigger than a deluxe room in Hong Kong. It was cleaned daily & shampoo, soap etc were always replenished. The front desk staff were fine, even offering to change heaps of coins we had for notes. Breakfast was good as before - not as much choice as we had in Hong Kong but there was plenty all the same. We like the location, is only a few minutes walk down to Orchard Road & Lucky Plaza & there is a basement supermarket nearby on Orchard Road also which is handy for "bits & pieces" you might need. It's only a short walk further on to the MRT & we got the train to most of the places we went to, although we used taxis a fair bit last time we were here - they are not expensive compared to the taxis in Australia. The walk up the hill at the end of the day can be tiring in the heat but it's not unmanageable. The only criticism I would have is the shower - the shower head is quite outdated & it would be good if it was upgraded. All the staff we encountered were pleasant & friendly, we would definitely stay there again if we went back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you love hiking!”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Swissotel Stamford but for this trip, someone else made the booking for us. Location: It's supposed to be near Orchard Road, but it's actually at least a 15 minute walk to the Orchard Road MRT. I usually don't mind walking but beware: you'll be walking under Singapore's intensely blazing sun (there's no shade whatsoever!) and when going back from Orchard to your hotel, you'll be walking UPHILL! Now, you may say, "I don't walk, I take cabs" Well, you'll be surprised at the heavy traffic there - the road going to York Hotel has Mt Elizabeth Hospital along it as well so there are traffic jams always. Hotel lobby: The taxi drops you off in front of the lobby where you'll be faced with a steep row of steps - no ramp anywhere! We had to haul our luggage up these steps by ourselves (these are not the short, 3-4 step type lobby, but rather 20++ steps) while the bellboys looked on, not offering any assistance. Hotel room: Granted, the room is HUGE, but it smells and feels musty. Plus, the TV is mounted on the wall, facing the window. You cannot move the TV to face either the bed or the sofa. So basically it means you stand in the middle of the room to watch TV as there are no seats within viewing range of the TV. Hotel Breakfast: The selection was ok, but beware of your tables - they don't wipe the tables after someone vacates it and you sit at it - so you'll have ketchup stained tissue where your utensils are wrapped in. Price: We always stay at Swissotel, which has clean, comfy rooms and is located within the Raffles City mall (very convenient when you need to grab a quick bite, buy water, etc) AND is right above the City Hall MRT station. We discovered that it was actually cheaper per night at Swissotel than at York! We paid about SGD260 per night for York and my sister, who was at the Swissotel, paid the same but for a Grand Room (the regular room was about SGD210) Anyway in short, never again!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant, disinterested front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: atin65
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever trip to Singapore after 8weeks travelling in Japan, Malaysia and Bali. Tired and on reaching this hotel from the airport our first contact with the York Hotel was the front desk staff who we found to all be disinterested and aloof bordering on downright rude. (A smile to a customer would probably split their faces wide open!) This didn't change throughout our entire stay. All other staff members, particularly the housekeeping staff were good though. We found the hotel WiFi very expensive particularly after having complimentary WiFi in our hotels throughout Japan, Malaysia and Bali. Pool drinks were very expensive (2xkids juice, 1xbeer) cost about AUD$35!!! All in all our experience with the front desk staff at the York Hotel left a very negative impression of Singapore and we couldn't wait to leave - would NEVER return unless it was to transit through Singapore Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Quite nice pool for City Centre, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PaulFarnhamUK
Reviews.Content: It is a large hotel. Service was poor (this was the only place I found in Asia where ALL the staff were really unfriendly. We had a very large familly room, two double beds. Very clean. Swimming pool was nice and quite (in a central courtyard with palm trees). Location is very nice, 100m from the central shopping district, but on a quite road.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfort but unfriendly staff..”
Reviews.Author: feindui
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews about this hotel, good and bad. And after I stayed for 4 nights, it was a bad impression on the performance of staff is true. Every morning I have to call to ask for toothpaste and slippers, service front desk staff was not friendly and cheap smile. Besides all the good, the food, location is very close to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Some good rooms if you know what to ask for”
Reviews.Author: Sculthorpe-Pike
Reviews.Content: Just a quick tip. The York is like all other, slightly boring mid-range hotels in singapore but the Cabana rooms next to the pool are a bit different and make you feel that you really are on vacation. Not the normal 'box with a box in the corner'. We were in room 102 and were very happy. Check them out. The only slight downside was a slight noise that came on at 6.30 a.m. from the (kitchen?) air conditioner unit above the room, in the car park. However, apart from that, the room was quiet, huge and cool and we could relax or wander down to Orchard Road whenever we wanted. Room 104 isn't as good and the aircon was noisy but there are others down there that are like room 102. vist them first, before you agree to take a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyraba
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back home from this hotel. I can see the place and location is not a problem. The room is clean and the facilities in this place are excellent. Now, here lies the problem. The staff at the door is simply too ignorance, doesn't care for guest carrying big luggage(myself). Bathroom is big but when taking shower, the water runs from the cubicle and travel to the front.So, i have to put my tower on it. The bed is big and the room is fine but the pillow makes my head very painful when i wake up in the morning. Anyway, this hotel worth staying and bell boy should be alert when guest is arriving and help them carry their belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal, Great Location and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: centrepa
Reviews.Content: We discovered the York through a review that mentioned they had rooms that could fit a family of four. Given the price of ANY room in Singapore we hoped the York would offer a bit more value not sacrifice quality and prevent us from having to pay for two rooms. We were not disappointed. We booked through Agoda and got a decent deal (even though we could not officially put the fourth child in the booking, it all went through without a hitch). As everyone has noted here the location near Orchard Street is convenient (but behind the Mt Elizabeth Hospital, so very quiet). We had a tower room with a three twin beds and a pull out sofa. The bath room was huge, a walk in closet, a desk and a small sitting area. The cleaning staff was amazing. The only down side was the high price for internet and the rather uneven desk service. But none of these makes me second-guess our stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, others OK”
Reviews.Author: Yousuf007
Reviews.Content: Its 5 mins walking distance to Orchard road, Paragon, lucky plaza etc. coming back is uphill. Quite place. I was given a very big room with 2 large double beds, good for my kids. LCD TV. Toilet was a bit small but had everything needed. The Check-in was fast and the luggage was in our room door before we were there. Checkout was also very fast but the staff was very busy and unpleasant. When I asked who will bring down our luggage, she said it was the bell boy's duty not her. The bell boys were very helpful everyday, even with calling taxi, where movie theter was etc. info. Our room rate was included with 4 breakfast, but the breakfast option was very limited. Also the breakfast area was onway to the lifts so inconvenient. The reception look needs to be modified. Orchard road hotels should be better looking. the room had large window but as we were in 4th floor so the view was limited. The children pool was extremely small. Rate was reasonable keeping in mind of other hotels in Orchard road, otherwise the price would be high. On teh day of checkout I asked them for late checkout and they told me that 2 PM is OK. But when I wanted to open the room door at 1PM, the card would not work, meaning they did not update their system. I had to ask the housekeeping to open the door. It was awkward. Otherwise, if you need to be in Orchard road area then this hotel rate is good compared to others and hotel is good. But if you can stay in other areas then do that, York is pricy for its service.

Reviews.Title: “greate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AwaraDeep
Reviews.Content: greate hotel, beautiful environment

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Brady_Bunch
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the York Hotel in Singapore. We had two rooms (3 per room). Each room had a queen bed with an extra foldaway bed for the 3rd occupant. I don't really have much to say about this hotel (positive or negative) except that it was "OK". We were out most of the day so we weren't intending on using the hotel facilites. Housekeeping was slow getting the extra beds to our rooms (i.e. we checked in at 6pm and had to make several phone calls to get the beds in after our return to the hotel at 10pm.) The staff though were friendly and couteous. If you just need a bed in a convenient location then it is fine but don't expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: kawaifan
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a chaotic scene where 3 reception staff were dealing with a large number of people checking out (from the same group). Inquired about checking in. Was told to go to the other counter. There was nobody there. When the large group left, I asked again when I could check-in, was ignored. Third time, I was told that check in time was at 2 pm. I was still trying to explain that I had already informed the hotel of my early arrival when I made my booking but staff ignored me again and took a call (forgot to get the name of the staff). Eventually was told by another staff that the hotel was fully booked (that was after they checked out a large group of people 15 minutes ago) and she would try to find me a room but if she couldn't find me a room, I would have to wait until 2 pm. After flying for 12 hours with barely enough sleep that wasn't good enough. She did find me a room but I was told they were still cleaning it and told me to wait for one hour. On checking out and asking the reception staff (different one) if they could call the airport shuttle, was told that they do not provide airport shuttle and there is only the taxi. I arrived on the airport shuttle the day I checked in so I knew that the shuttle provides drop off and pick up services. When I told the staff about this, was informed that he doesn't know anything about it and to just talk to the concierge. I don't know where the hotel gets its reception staff but they are the most ill-informed, ill-mannered staff I have encountered. As they are the first (next to the guard) guests meet, their attitude is a major turn off. Plus points: guard, bell hop and concierge were friendly and knew how to treat guests, giving tips when necessary. Room was spacious and clean. Tea and coffee making facilities provided. However, I would not be returning to this hotel. I am sure there are other hotels out there with better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrHanifah
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights. Reached and check in by late midnight. The check in was fast and no problem with the procedure. Room is small but ok for single. Breakfast was good though tough for me as a Muslim, no sure whether foods were halal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotlel is fine but isolated”
Reviews.Author: bombersimon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. Rooms are of good standard and spacious enough to spread out a bit. Breakfast is a bit on the expensive side at $26 plus tax. My main gripe is that the hotel is quite isolated (by Singaporean standards). The nearest MRT stations are walkable but you will have warmed up by the time you get there. Restaurants are scarce and entail either a long walk, a cab trip or MRT journey if you want to get into areas of interesting food and choice. I ended up eating at the Newton Food Centre (night market) which is a pleasant enough 10 minute walk. The relative remoteness would deter me from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, reasonably priced, and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: browneyedgirlManila
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints with this hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable with all the basic amenities expected in a hotel. Breakfast was wonderful, we hadn't even started our day of sightseeing and already we were extremely stuffed! Service was also excellent, the front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. No problems whatsoever, and the hotel didn't charge us an arm and a leg too. The only downside would be the 10-minute walk we would have to take in order to get to and from Orchard. It can get tiring especially if you're on the way home laden with tons of shopping bags after a whole day of shopping. There are also no accessible MTR stations closeby, so you would really either have to walk or spend a little more on a taxi. I wouldn't recommend this if you were traveling with little kids, the walk under the tropical heat would definitely tire them out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Clean Hotel with very Friendly and Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: amcuryo
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this Hotel on our stopover to the UK and on our return from the Uk in JUly and September.The rooms were great value for money, the staff very friendly and helpful. On our stopover on our way to the UK our connecting flight didnt leave until 9pm. We were allowed stay in our room until 3pm then we were given completmentary towels and invited to use the pool or have a shower before our departure. This was very well received as we had been out all day and the weather was very hot and humid. It was great to get on the plane feeling clean and refreshed. This hotel is in a great location, a short walk to Orchard Road and a very short walk to a great shopping centre. There was no street noise, with our room over looking the pool.On our return we had to have a smoking room which we didnt mind however there was no odour of cigarettes,(we are not smokers)

Reviews.Title: “a worth to stay in Suite room for a stop over holiday!”
Reviews.Author: simplepinay
Reviews.Content: Excellent cleanliness and Food Service,Friendly Personnel.They offer buffet Breakfast with different variation from Western till Oriental Taste.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: weescotsguy66
Reviews.Content: Staff have been there for years a good sign that they love their jobs All very helpful. Now newly refurbished but still has the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value + good location”
Reviews.Author: jodanstar
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a couple of nights at The York. It's a fairly basic hotel, 3 1/2 stars in my book. We stayed in a tower room which was large enough for a family of 4. The rooms were clean, the service was good, and the rates quite reasonable. The included buffet breakfast was just your basic stuff - if you had just left a 5 star Asian property as we just had, it's very underwhelming. I guess you get what you pay for, however. We had to leave early on our last day, so the hotel gave each of us a simple, takeaway breakfast which was a nice touch. The location is very good, just a short walk to Orchard Rd, and less than 30 minutes by cab to the airport. For a stopover or short stay, it's a pretty safe choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard”
Reviews.Author: MathurSingapore
Reviews.Content: nice services and pool, liked the breakfast very much...try the annexe building rooms on high floor. Excellent location next to orchard road..overal value

Reviews.Title: “Standard services”
Reviews.Author: AnujSingapore
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1 month..overall good stay. try to avoid annexe building since it is old.

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: booLincoln
Reviews.Content: staff very lazy there was a problem with my booking bed and breakfast they only had it down for room only they made me phone england to get the firm i booked with to talk to them about my booking they even charged me for phone call when they could have done it themselfs

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Gildenise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The room was very clean,spacious and comfoftable. We only stayed two nights as a stopover on our way to Oz. Called on way back also two months later. Both times excellent. The huge buffet breakfast was superb. Everything one could want. Staff very good. Location Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChickenRiceHunter
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in a room on the 12th floor. Decent view, decent room. Very clean. Lots of hot water. Decor nothing special. Sheets lovely, but pillows a bit thin. Good location: a quick walk to Borders down the road for those from bookshop-deprived countries. Colleagues of mine having a rather raucous get-together in another room (no music, just talking) received a visit from security -- perhaps the walls are thin! Breakfast not included so did not try, although a look at the menu suggested it was a bit expensive, but so is everything in Singapore. Arrived in the afternoon and checked out in the morning -- staff professional and efficient. Not a lot of character, but what can you expect?

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit by preference”
Reviews.Author: chumpies
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and we got the standard room we booked, but weren't dissappointed.Our previous review stands for the continued quality of this hotel. Again staff in all ares were excellent. Our only monor complaints were that the breakfast range was less than the fist day ( the cuse of setting such a usually high standard) and the carpet outside the lift on our floor was a l9ittle smelly having been recently washed we presume.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: JulieDRochesterNY
Reviews.Content: I was advised to use this hotel by locals, and they were right! The room was large, clean, with all amenities. Room service was timely and courteous. Food at the hotel was terrific, and the Singapore Sling was far better than the one I had at Raffles' Long Bar. I had the good fortune to be staying there during the annual hawker's fair, allowing for a wide variety of authentic foods. While this hotel is far enough away from Orchard that it is quiet, it is only a few minute walk to the thick of the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: LambrettaMike
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a Singapore Stopover through SIngapore Airlines on our way to India. I was a little concerned when I read some of the reviews here... I'm convinced now that there must be another York Hotel in Singapore. This place was clean, quiet, well taken care of. We were treated very well, including the children. It is a short pleasant walk down to Orchard Street and the metro. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable (for Singapore) hotel for a Singapore Stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Imedvindfranord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel one night, arriving from Lombok. Our stay was only a stop over, leaving to Europe the day after. The staff was extremely nice! The young man at the front desk, was very helpful. When we asked him if we could store our luggage in the hotel since our flight did not leave before 23.40, he said we could chech out at 1500 hr. and not at noon - without extra cost! Great service. The room was nice and the bed very comfartable. The breakfast was very good, though a little expencive. The location is perfect! Just a few minutes walk from the main shopping street of Singapore. All in all; very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff & Shabby Rooms - Dont bother!”
Reviews.Author: london37
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior double room direct with the hotel. On arrival the rude woman on check in said we didnt have a reservation. She sent me off to the internet to print my booking details. I returned and she begun loading all the details into their system. After waiting around (it was 1am and we were shattered) the woman told us they had no superior rooms available. They gave us a smoking, twin bed room. YUK! The woman told us to take a look at the room and see what we thought. As soon as we steped out of the lift the fumes of cigarette smoke hit us! Disgusting! The room was shabby and needed a good clean. Back at reception, I suggested that in that case, they should upgrade us as they have confirmed they had superior, double rooms available - clearly they didnt! The woman gave me a heavy sigh and dirty look....rude, rude, rude. I asked to speak to the duty manager who was the most arrogant man ive ever come across. He said we'd be charged and we'd have to take it as 'thats all we have to offer you'. After much debating and stress, the duty manager said 'i'll move one of my regular customers' as if he was doing us a favour! and we were put in a deluxe room with a double bed. Hooray - we thought - until we entered the room. It wasnt very clean and needed to be modernised. There are plenty of nicer hotels with pleasant staff ...avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply the worst hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: avgasadelaide
Reviews.Content: Front reception staff were racist and totally unprofessional from the first moments of our check-in. Talking under breath and laughing snidely (female staff - duty manager seemed very awkward about their demeanour but did not step in as I would have expected.) Upset my partner to point of tears which was a great way to start a holiday. The room was a joke. Double bed made of two mismatched height single beds that when questioned we were made to feel we were being fussy? Oh give me a break... Changed to another room in unbelievably poor condition, peeling window tint, mould etc. I was beginning to expect to meet Basil Fawlty... Breakfast was passable but smell from restaurant in evening was appalling. This was a common conversation with other guests in the lifts. Some staff were trying but if your front staff cannot cut it then all does not bode well. Even the worst Vegas and European hotel I have stayed at was 4 star in comparison to the Yorke. At least i can never say I have as a guest been treated with such disrespect. Yes we tried to transfer but travel agent via the Flight Centre in Australia was totally useless. The only saving grace for our stay was the botanical gardens. Quite sensational. But Singapore as a whole? Baby you are not what you used to be!

Reviews.Title: “uncaring staff”
Reviews.Author: Taniath
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the York in Nov 2006 and arrived at 2am. Had to wait for around 30 mins until room was ready despite it being pre-booked. My room connected to another thru a doorway and the sound of next door arguing was very loud, and then a dog started barking! Despite it being a non-smoking floor they were smoking and my room stunk of tobacco. I went to the front desk and complained. The staff argued it was the tv set making the dog sound and not an actual dog! The next morning I continued to complain and eventually they gave me a new room on the top floor. It was some kind of basic suite. The air-con was two settings- off or full-blast, and if turned off, the smoke detector would bleep all night. As I was there 7 days this became annoying. The new room was a good size but the previous one was awful. If you are looking for a cheapie room this hotel's okay. The hill hike is hard in the afternoon heat and at night there is little street lighting, I wouldn't stay again, next trip I went to the Swisshotel Stamford which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Rod1961
Reviews.Content: Arrived 1.30am local time after a Qantus malfunction. Staff were expecting us and had no trouble at all. The Staff could not do enough for you, whether it was at the Reception Desk, the Housekeeping staff, the Restaurant staff, even the Security staff and Tour desk staff They all made the stay extremely pleasant. Rooms and Hotel were clean, beds are extremely firm but still comfortable, Air con works too well, breakfast was good but can err a little on the bland side at times. We were picked up for our tours and dropped off back at the Hotel. The bad things were the cost of their laundry service ( $8 for a shirt) and their mini bar prices. Our breakfast was included but going by their menu could have been expensive if bought separetly Location is good. Short downhill walk to Orchard Rd, even though the return uphill trip seems longerand in the case of a emergency the Mount Elizabeth Hospital is just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: bowlie1
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel as the price when i stayed was incredibly cheap so i was not expecting much. However on arrival the decor was very modern and elegant and our room was beautiful with a view of the pool. It was quite spacious and the bed was comfortable. The hotel was situated in a great spot just off orchard rd. The staff were friendly and efficient. I would definately stay there again. Value for money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: headspinning
Reviews.Content: I know it's 12 months ago but just wanted to give a review. Stayed at the York for 4 nights in Oct 07, would stay there again. On arrival there seemed to be a problem with the room so I was a little concerned. Low and behold, they upgraded us to a suite. It was huge, clean and comfy. Great location for Orchard Road shopping. Small walk back up the hill if you take Mt Elizabeth Road past the hospital but nothing to complain about. Breakfast was good, heaps of food every morning. Didn't eat any other meals at the hotel, far too many choices elsewhere. Having stayed on Orchard Road before the York is certainly a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: davjav
Reviews.Content: we booked 4 days here - great position - only a few minuites walk from Orchard Road-very clean - large rooms and all round good value - would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Could've Been Better...”
Reviews.Author: May29
Reviews.Content: The first impressions were of rather hard-line reception staff. The airconditioning was noisy and couldn't sleep, so turned it off, then awoke all hot and breathless later, so had to get up and turn it on again. The cooked breakfast was horrible. The pool area was nice with waiters bringing refreshing drinks, but too humid for me.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant stay at York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJAB
Reviews.Content: My family ( my husband, myself and our 21 months son) stayed at York Hotel last July 4, 2008 and the hotel had been our home for 5 days. Our room is nice with all the necessities we needed. The breakfast is great with lots of varieties of food. It is conveniently located in the heart of Orchard Rd. It is very accessible and everybody seems to know the place. The staff of the hotel are all good and very accommodating. Generally, it is a pleasant stay . We love Singapore and will definitely come back and stay at York Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ShortbreadAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the York, very pleasent experince. No smoke smells in our room . Hotel clean our room was spacious, I used the pool every morning after my walk to the botanical gardens beautiful. York is 3 mins walk to orchard road thru the carpark, loved Far East Plaza & Lucky Plaza, we ate at the hotel resturant as we recieved 50% off. food good. Loved Singapore will return , will return to the york

Reviews.Title: “Hated the York”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeVisitor
Reviews.Content: Incredible stench of tobacco smoke throughout the premises, even on the "non-smoking" floors, broken security locks on the doors and windows, loud airconditioning which was intermittent at best, non-functional at worst. My family and I (2 adults, 3 children) will never stay there again, and would never recommend this hotel to anyone with any sensitivity to smoking. For those addicted to the cancer sticks; go for your life.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: bug09
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for one night. The room we booked (double) through Wotif was large and clean. Orchard Road was about a 5 minute walk away, and it cost us less than $20 (Singapore) to get to and from the airport (taxi). Breakfast was part of the package and included a selection of hot and cold food in the cafe downstairs. The hotel appears to be going through some improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise - beautifully refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Mango53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May 2008 for a shopping holiday. The photos previously posted here are quite old because the hotel has been completely refurbished - the rooms still smell of fresh paint. (I will update with pics later). We paid $194 AU per night which is quite high because our stay landed during some trade convention. Either way accomodation in Singapore is very expensive for Asia. For this price I was tossing up between this hotel and Rendezvous and this hotel was much closer to shopping. Positives - Very clean newly refurbished rooms and hotel overall. I believe they are doing floor by floor and noticed that the lower floors still had old carpet in the foyers when we looked out of the lift but not sure about the rooms. They had notices that there was refurbishments going on during business hours but we didnt hear anything much. We heard more from the building of the Quincy hotel next door but didnt spend much time in the room to care. - Location: 5min walk to Orchard Rd/Scotts Rd and Orchard Rd MRT(- Near a large hospital if you need medical attention Negatives - Internet access was $SG 2 for 15min, there were 2 computers in the lobby open 24hrs however you couldnt top up until it ran out and there were no warnings so i noticed every single person would get cut halfway through browsing etc and would have to put $2 in just to log out of their email accounts, msn etc. - Lifts were very slow - Pool and Jacuzzi showing its age, needs to be refurbed to match hotel - Bought a small Evian water 400mls from the hotel cafe for $6?! - The steep incline from Scotts Rd - which we didnt notice until the 3rd day of non-stop shopping and our legs were tired so please take this into consideration if you are less mobile i.e. i think it would be hard for older ppl walking up that hill during the hotter part of the day or if you were carrying young toddlers. I would stay here if you are on a budget but still want to be walking distance to Orchard Rd. I would definitely pick this over the Elizabeth even though the Elizabeth looks closer. However if I were to return to Singapore (which I doubt as I found KL had the exact same brands but better exchange rate) I would pay the extra to be located smack on Orchard Rd e.g. The Meritus Mandarin..

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: richli808
Reviews.Content: We had a very large room, perfect for a family (2 adults and two small children). The staff provided an extra, single bed for my daughter at no extra charge. The rest of us (3) slept in the King sized bed - plenty of room for two adults and a two year old. We stayed one night at the hotel. The room was clean, and reasonably newly refurbished. Clean bathroom with bath and separate shower. Very friendly staff. Nice pool and good fitness centre. Breakfast buffet not spectacular, go to Orchard road (5 minutes walk) for better food at better prices. Reasonable rate SGD225 per night, booked hotel through Singapore Airlines stopover programme - I thoroughly recommend this programme. The SIA stopover programme was the only way I could get a hotel at a "reasonable" price.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Chessa48
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days and found the York a great Location, 5 mins walk to Orchard Road, large room and very good, clean, quiet, staff very good, Breakfast good...(eggs not hot sometimes), TV coverage poor. Room not ready when we arrived 6.30p which was not good after a flight from Australia. Would definately stay there again. Maybe they could offer free Broadband in these days which would be a bonus..

Reviews.Title: “loved the york”
Reviews.Author: Bleaty
Reviews.Content: Stopped off at the York for 3 days to show the 3 teenage kids around Singapore. We had 2 rooms on the same floor. Rooms were large, clean, with nice firm beds. 1 room not ready upon arrival - so we were given free drink voucher. Reception staff very professional and helpful when we needed medical assistance for 1 teenager. We ate in the restaurant 2 nights and found the meals to be fine and not expensive. Breakfast buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Go Under, stop over and stay at The York!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jch2009
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i ended up staying here by mistake, it was the best mistake we have ever made. The York was a 'gem' right in the heart of the shopping on orchard road (handy for xmas prezzies). Spacious and very clean, fast enough check-in and the breakfast was plenty and varied to cater for most. We also found the 'infamous' hard beds very comfortable (maybe they have changed them???) As a stopover hotel we found it perfect for our needs and when we go back to discover singapore a bit more (we only had 36 hours) would certainly stay there again. If i had any complaint (sorry) but the receptionist could relax a bit more, smile and look as though they enjoy it. After a 13 hour flight it's not much to ask, go on girls you can do it. Otherwise, a very good place to lie your head for a while!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: tranquil
Reviews.Content: basic, simple, no frills hotel. Walking distance to the shopping street, easy access. I stayed there for about 10 days. Buffet breakfast is pretty basic.Swimming pool is only available during the day. Receptionist / duty manager is always busy - I called more than 5 times with no pickup. Other than that, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “York Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaWayne
Reviews.Content: My family, (Mum, Dad, 11yo boy and 8yo girl) spent 9 nights at the York, and would certainly stay again. With kids try and get a corner room for extra space. I was extremely happy with the hotel itself, and staff. Kids loved the pool the most. Its approximately 7 minute walk to Orchard Road out the front entrance and a couple minute walk to Scotts Rd and the Far East Plaza out the back entrance. Only downside was the breakfast, while there was a good selection on the buffet table, it was a little bland. If we stay there again I wouldnt get the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “HARD beds”
Reviews.Author: wombies
Reviews.Content: Read all the other reveiws and didn't think a bed could be as hard as they said, but they are really hard, think sleeping on the floor and that is exactly how hard these beds are. All we really want when we go away is a clean room and a bed as we go sightseeing etc and a room is somewhere to sleep and shower.So this is not a case of princess and the pea. The rooms are clean and spacious. We stayed in the tower suites which have been renovated. 2 adults and 2 children in the room fitted comfortably. 1 boy had the sofa bed pulled out of a night and the other had a proper bed, not one of those little fold away beds. The cabana rooms and fitness centre had just finished being renovated when we left. i didnt see the motel rooms though. The pool area is fairly standard and has a childrens pool as well. A lovely man at the bar checks regularly if you would like drinks or snacks. Did not have room service during our stay. TV was fine but some channels recption was not the best. Housekeeping were helpful with any requests for towels soap etc. Our boys loved Omar at the door and he always had a friendly word and smile. The reception staff are plain rude and unhelpful. There was a mix up as we had paid for breakfast AND it was on our itenary but the reception had only a room booked and no breakfast. I spoke to nearly every recption staff member and manager with not an ounce of help. On the fifth day I then rang the travel agent myself, it was quickly rectified that day. This was very frustrating and the reception staff could have fixed it all very quickly if they had of contacted my travel agent directly as I had requested. Breakfast itself was a buffet with a good variety and well stocked. It was part of our package and we had a great deal but if you have to pay the regular price go to any of the food places close by. It is not a long walk to Orchard road. 5-10mins. Go through the goodwood park carpark ( at the back of orchard hotel) this will take you to scotts road turn left and you walk down to orchard road. We found taxis cheap and convenient. The MRT was clean and fast but for price and convenience we used taxis for the four of us. I would not stay here if I had to pay the full price but for the great deal we got (7 nights for the price of 3 with breakfast)it was fine. Loved Singapore and the people are the friendliest most helpful I have ever come across. We saw as much as we could and every day was full of activities. A great family destination.

Reviews.Title: “york hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozzichick
Reviews.Content: Large room size Quiet& clean Huge buffet breakfast Pillows too hard

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: KenYorkshire_England
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights as part of a package. Check in was effficient and the room was spacious,modern and very clean.Breakfast was included and we found the choice and service were excellent. Trips to all major sites could be booked in the foyer and were reasonably priced. It was only a short stroll down onto Orchard Road. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: scubanutty
Reviews.Content: Check In.... We were a party of 14. Our rooms were booked by our travel agent at least three months in advance. When we arrived each individual was booked in one room. It took a bit of time to get them to understand that we needed 7 rooms not 14... we were placed in rooms, all except two were in smoking rooms although the travel agent gave strict instructions that we were to have non-smoking rooms. When we tried to change rooms were were told there were no rooms available... yet there were 7 extra when we arrived. The front staff was NOT friendly, even before the problems began. Rooms.... Despite the lobby appearing above average the rooms were not. They are in severe need of cleaning, refurbishing and remodeling. The carpets were stained and worn, The rooms were smelly... The halls were smelly, even the nonsmoking rooms. One of my friends said that they found a dirty washcloth on the top of the shower rod when they arrived, and when we left two days later, it was still up on the rod. Restaurant Was the only high point. We only ate one meal, but it was good. Not excellent as a 4 star would be expected, but good and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - bad sleep!”
Reviews.Author: AsiaLou
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults 2 young children) stayed at the York on a family package for the May Labour day weekend. Excellent location - peaceful but handy for Orchard road. Very large, clean room. Nice pool and reception areas. Quite a good deal for our 3 night stay. - though be aware of 16% taxes on top of prices! However, the reception staff were unwelcoming; the hotel bar/nightclub was dingy with sky high prices (unless you fancy buying a whole bottle of brandy!) and though it was in the hotel building you couldn't charge to your room bill. And the beds were the most uncomfortable I have slept on!! Rock hard pillows and rock hard beds - even the children complained! Room lacked what nowadays comes as standard - hairdriers, a kettle, even a hotel guide. Breakfast was not included in the price - which I thought was just mean! You could park for free in the car park - if you only left once! If you went out and returned you would be charged very expensive day rates! Everything smacked of cheapness/ cost cutting for high profits! So, stay here if you want a cheap(ish) hotel in a good location but bring your own pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hospitality”
Reviews.Author: momkait
Reviews.Content: We took this hotel as part of a package (airline + hotel) deal- serving the purpose of stopping over in Singapore for a few days, before our flight to Los Angeles. I was in Singapore with my infant daughter (1year old) and both of my parents. We arrived at this hotel around 9am and when we arrived at the check-in (there were lots of customers lined up at the receptionist area), the Indian lady was telling us that check in time was 12 pm, so she just wrote down our room number in a tiny piece of paper and asked us to come back at 12 and she then said "NEXT" towards other customers (how rude). As I asked her whether I could get into my room right now, she replied "NO MAM, ur room is being cleaned". And she told me again to come back at 12 and "NEXT" to the other customer. Meanwhile, I watched other customers (served by other receptionists) that were alloved to check in and were getting into the elevator going to their rooms. I was so mad, as u can imagine, I was having the earliest flight (flight departing at 6, meaning we woke up at 4am going to the airport), plus with an infant that was waken up at 4am....Then, I asked the concierge people (for my baggages) and asked him why I could not get my room and other people could have their room ready, and the concierge guy just smiled and told me to line up again and to get other receptionist. I lined up again at the receptionist section, and this time purposely lined up to be served by other receptionist. This time I got lucky, I was served by the MANAGER. I told her my story, and I told her why I was not let into my room, while there were lots of people who were able to be checked in and to go to their rooms. She apologized and told me that she would have a talk to the lady, and rightaway she gave me another room. She called the housekeeping to make sure that my room was ready and cleaned and to send another rollaway bed. Once I arrived at my room, the phone was ringing, and the manager asked me if everthing was fine now. I told her that everything was fine, and I thanked her and I told her that I would be writing some comments about my experience in this hotel. The room itself is okay, clean and neat. It is small, but it is bearable, the bathroom is tidy and clean. The housekeeping lady was very nice, once she made up the rollaway bed, rightaway she gave us more towels as she realized that there were 3 adults in the room with an infant. So I thanked her for that. The hotel is about 15-25 minutes walking distance to Orchard Road (it is a bit uphill). I will try other hotels for my next visit .

Reviews.Title: “Solid value for money”
Reviews.Author: tavelerwho
Reviews.Content: My family (my wife and I and two teenagers - 17 and 15) stayed for a number of nights at The York. I am a constant traveller to the city-state and I was there to work and share some time with the family when I could. The family enjoyed the hotel's location and we all enjoyed the cleanliness the attitude of the staff and their consistent friendly service. The price was very good and the capacity to place us all in a room (with two roll away beds for the teenagers) and not be overly cramped was a significant plus for us. It was a very pleasant time for us all.

Reviews.Title: “york poor hospitality terrible”
Reviews.Author: lpsukroo
Reviews.Content: my fiance and i just came off the gemini star cruises and were absolutly spoilt. then to come to the york and ask the reception if we could book in 2 hours early our response was no your booking time is 2 pm no rooms are available - surely out of all the rooms 1 would of been available - any reception staff very rude and didnt want to be there = or so it seams room was ok - didnt use the pool. but was average for the price think you can get beta accommodation in singapore - fair walk to orchard - after a long day who wants to walk that far - taxi was usually the go. what every one else said on this review page about the terrible service hotel food etc is absolutly true - if you dont want good service good food only a reasonable sorta room well stay at the york - other wise choose else where - you have been warned..

Reviews.Title: “Okay but avoid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MelissaR
Reviews.Content: Room a bit shabby but was a good size and relatively large. TV was difficult with few channel selections and kept going loud and staticky during ad breaks. Pool was good, with nice setting. Hotel Lobby had no real service to speak of, no offer to help with our bags, and wireless internet only worked in the lobby (lobby set up with couches only). Staff not friendly. Hotel is close to Orchard, but still a fair hike (difficult if you're not used to the heat!). Probably our worst memory was of the breakfast. Too far to walk to Orchard Rd for breakfast so thought we'd try the buffet. Buffet selection for European style food was abysmal. Bacon and eggs were greasy and nasty, croissants tasted weird and "fresh"milk turned out to be UHT milk. Best we could get was some fresh fruit. Not good for SGD$24+++ each. Other than that, an okay place.

Reviews.Title: “noisey, rude, shabby & uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: B2A1C3
Reviews.Content: Reception was unfriendly upon check in and requests for information appeared too hard and were either ill informed or could not provide the information - my room was shabby with holes in bedcovers, blankets too narrow to stay tucked in, air conditioning freezing, even on low, room service food was prompt on delivery, but very ordinary and basic. Their site advertises that the Hotel is under renovation from 8:00am until 7:00pm, but during my 4 night stay renovations continued well into each night. It was noisey and smelt very strongly of building materials. The walls and ceiling of my room allowed me to hear guests next door and above. It was very uncomfortable waiting to be picked up for tours and final transfer to the airport, as there was not anywhere to sit in the reception area, not a single chair, or even a step, so it meant just literally standing around. This no chair situation was compounded upon my check out time of 12 noon, with my transfer pick up time scheduled for 5:30pm - perhaps I was expected to stand out my 5 and a 1/2 hour wait. My choice was to extend my room at an additional cost of $S116.00 seemed the only solution. The bell boys were co-operative, but there was not a baggage room, so all luggage was placed along a wall, which could have enabled tampering or theft. Very disappointing - will not be staying there again - I stop over in Singapore every 6 to 12 months on my way back from the UK.
